triggers.name: firmware has changed
triggers.description: Firmware version has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

triggers.name: device has been replaced
triggers.event_name: device has been replaced (new serial number received)
triggers.description: Device serial number has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

triggers.name: operating system description has changed
triggers.description: The description of the operating system has changed. Possible reasons are that the system has been updated or replaced. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

items.name: walk discovery - sensors temperature
items.description:
MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlTemperature
Since temperature sensor is not available on all Mikrotik hardware, this is done to avoid unsupported items.

MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlProcessorTemperature
Since temperature of CPU is not available on all Mikrotik hardware, this is done to avoid unsupported items.

discovery_rules.name: temp sensor discovery
discovery_rules.description:
MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlTemperature
Since temperature sensor is not available on all Mikrotik hardware, this is done to avoid unsupported items.

trigger_prototypes.name: cpu: temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototypes.event_name: cpu: temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP.CRIT:"CPU"}
trigger_prototypes.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available.

trigger_prototypes.name: cpu: temp is above warning threshold
trigger_prototypes.event_name: cpu: temp is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP.WARN:"Device"}
trigger_prototypes.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available.

dependencies.name: device: temp is above critical threshold

item_prototypes.name: device: temp
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrHlTemperature Device temperature in Celsius (degrees C).
Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..).

Reference: http://wiki.mikrotik.com/wiki/Manual:SNMP

trigger_prototypes.name: device: temp is above critical threshold
trigger_prototypes.event_name: device: temp is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP.CRIT:"Device"}
trigger_prototypes.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available.

dependencies.name: cpu: temperature is above critical threshold

trigger_prototypes.name: device: temp is above warning threshold
trigger_prototypes.event_name: device: temp is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP.WARN:"Device"}
trigger_prototypes.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available.

dependencies.name: device: temp is above critical threshold

item_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem rsrp
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrLTEModemSignalRSRP Reference Signal Received Power.

trigger_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem rsrp is low
trigger_prototypes.event_name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem rsrp is low (below {$LTEMODEM.RSRP.MIN.WARN}dbm for 5m)

item_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem rsrq
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrLTEModemSignalRSRQ Reference Signal Received Quality.

trigger_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem rsrq is low
trigger_prototypes.event_name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem rsrq is low (below {$LTEMODEM.RSRQ.MIN.WARN}db for 5m)

item_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem rssi
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrLTEModemSignalRSSI Received Signal Strength Indicator.

trigger_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem rssi is low
trigger_prototypes.event_name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem rssi is low (below {$LTEMODEM.RSSI.MIN.WARN}dbm for 5m)

item_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem sinr
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrLTEModemSignalSINR Signal to Interference & Noise Ratio.

trigger_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem sinr is low
trigger_prototypes.event_name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): lte modem sinr is low (below {$LTEMODEM.SINR.MIN.WARN}db for 5m)

item_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): ap authenticated clients
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrWlApAuthClientCount Number of authentication clients.

item_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): ssid
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrWlApSsid Service Set Identifier.

item_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): ap authenticated clients
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrWlCMAuthClientCount Number of authentication clients.

item_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): ap registered clients
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrWlCMRegClientCount Client established connection to AP, but didn't finish all authentication procedures for full connection.

item_prototypes.name: int {#IF.NAME} ({#IF.ALIAS}): ap state
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB
mtxrWlCMState Wireless interface state.

macros.description: This macro is used in LTE modem discovery. It can be overridden on the host.
This macro is used in CAPsMAN AP channel discovery. It can be overridden on the host level.
The LTE modem RSRP minimum value for warning trigger expression.
The LTE modem RSRQ minimum value for warning trigger expression.
The LTE modem RSSI minimum value for warning trigger expression.
The LTE modem SINR minimum value for warning trigger expression.
